title: Emerging investigator series: Coprecipitation with glucuronic acid limits reductive dissolution and transformation of ferrihydrite in an anoxic soil
content:
Environ. Sci.: Processes Impacts, 2024, Advance Article
DOI: 10.1039/D4EM00238E, Paper

Laurel K. ThomasArrigo, Luiza Notini, Sophie Vontobel, Sylvain Bouchet, Tabea Nydegger, Ruben Kretzschmar
Ferrihydrite, a poorly crystalline Fe(III)-oxyhydroxide, is abundant in soils and is often found associated with organic matter.
